corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

sentence.text: Bankruptcy will become even more commonplace .
In Italy and France , however , these super-irons are commonplace and account for 50 per cent of annual sales .
To mention infantile sexuality is now commonplace , although far from being fully acceptable or comprehensible to many people .
The commonplace accusations of medieval anti- feminism came to the Middle Ages as an ecclesiastical tradition .
Would ` teaching to the test " become so commonplace that assessment determines curriculum rather than curriculum determining assessment ?
Headlines about local councils demolishing blocks of flats 10 years old or younger have become commonplace in the past four years .
The problems of land degradation which characterise the Jamaican landscape are commonplace in many other Caribbean islands .
She used to make things that are now quite commonplace but which at the time seemed really exotic -- fabulous cakes like kugelhopf and filled croissants which were wheeled in on a trolley for tea .
These stories are commonplace , although those involved are wary of going on record .
She kept a commonplace book unknown to all but Dimity , who sometimes pointed out a passage in her reading which she felt might appeal to her friend .
The modern model helicopter has progressed to the point where learning to fly them is comparatively easy and loops and rolls are commonplace .
Acoustic players may well be delighted to know that RotoSound have developed their 80 / 20 Bronze strings as an alternative to the more commonplace phosphor bronze type .
The gas stove was commonplace enough , although very old , standing on four straight legs .
Ellwood 's clothes were so neutral in colour , so commonplace in style , that he seemed to fade as he dressed .
The other , however , is less commonplace .
Resignations through frustration became commonplace .
The most commonplace metonymic index of industry -- the factory chimney -- is also metaphorically a phallic symbol .
The work was always hard and sometimes dangerous ; accidents , some of them fatal , were commonplace .

Stealing ( or not paying other debts ) in order to gamble is commonplace and stories abound of any number of crimes -- even murder -- being committed for pitifully small amounts simply in order to gamble .
The shoulder charge was commonplace and the buffeting he received required him to be strong and brave .
Nausea seems a commonplace symptom .
